Mathematical Morphology

Mathematical morphology uses set theory to describe shapes. In image processing, operators from mathematical morphology can be used to pre-process or post-process images. The basic four morphological operators are dilation, erosion, opening, and closing. All operations involve an structuring element, and the result of each operation really describes the interaction between the input image and the structuring element.
